div.p: This case-insensitive code system http://tecnomod-um.org/CodeSystem/stroke-proc-not-done-reason-cs defines the following codes:

tr.td: The patient presented/evaluated outside the time window defined by protocol/guidelines for benefit.
No eligible large vessel occlusion for thrombectomy was identified.
A medical contraindication existed (e.g., bleeding risk or other high-risk factor).
The patient or legal representative declined the intervention after discussion.
The patient was transferred to a different facility for the intervention.
The facility could not provide the procedure (equipment, staffing, service availability).
Baseline disability made benefit unlikely per clinical judgement/protocol.
Neurological deficit severity was judged too mild to justify risk/benefit.
The procedure had already been performed at another facility prior to arrival/transfer.
Financial or coverage constraints prevented the procedure (use only where applicable).
Reason was not documented or is unknown.
Informed consent required for the procedure was not obtained.
Only MT was considered; IV thrombolysis was not performed.
Required angiographic assessment was not performed.
Other reason not listed. Prefer adding explanatory text in statusReason.text where possible.

title.value: Stroke Procedure Not Done Reasons CodeSystem

description.value:
Local CodeSystem enumerating standardized reasons why a key stroke procedure (e.g., IV thrombolysis or mechanical thrombectomy) was **not performed**.
**Primary use-case** - Populate `Procedure.statusReason` when `Procedure.status = not-done`.
**Why it matters** - Captures the difference between: - clinical ineligibility (contraindication), - time-based ineligibility (outside window), - operational constraints (unavailable), - patient choice (refusal), - care pathway differences (performed elsewhere / transfer).

definition.value: The patient presented/evaluated outside the time window defined by protocol/guidelines for benefit.
No eligible large vessel occlusion for thrombectomy was identified.
A medical contraindication existed (e.g., bleeding risk or other high-risk factor).
The patient or legal representative declined the intervention after discussion.
The patient was transferred to a different facility for the intervention.
The facility could not provide the procedure (equipment, staffing, service availability).
Baseline disability made benefit unlikely per clinical judgement/protocol.
Neurological deficit severity was judged too mild to justify risk/benefit.
The procedure had already been performed at another facility prior to arrival/transfer.
Financial or coverage constraints prevented the procedure (use only where applicable).
Reason was not documented or is unknown.
Informed consent required for the procedure was not obtained.
Only MT was considered; IV thrombolysis was not performed.
Required angiographic assessment was not performed.
Other reason not listed. Prefer adding explanatory text in statusReason.text where possible.
